thread.title: Diggers and Dealers 2015 over, skimpies go home
thread.title_full: Diggers and Dealers 2015 over, skimpies go home | afr.com

author: Will Glasgow
title: Diggers and Dealers 2015 over, skimpies go home
text:
Diggers and Dealers 2015 Ryan Stuart Share on twitter Share on Google Plus by Will Glasgow As you read this, cashed up skimpies (that's West Australian for almost naked barmaids) will be flying back to the Gold Coast.
Mining executives will be returning to the nation's capital cities with sore heads and perhaps a little less dignity than they had last week.
Some poor bastard will be doing their best to clean the floor of Ashok Parekh 's Palace Hotel.
Another Diggers and Dealers has come to an end. Before we move on, a nod for best at show at Kalgoorlie's Festival of Mining.
From a crowded field, we've picked diversified miner Metals X's chief executive, Peter Cook, after his performance at the conference podium on the closing day.
From the floor an investor asked a lumbering train of technical details? Cook's reply: "Four, yes, no, maybe, 200, 400 and next year".
After a round of applause, he approached a question on expansion spend seriously. "Around $30," he said, before adding: "You do know I am just making this up".
Pope Francis (and Aunty's Four Corners) might not agree, but we reckon mining is a wonderful industry.
